dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dragonhead prow of an ancient Viking ship cuts throug thick fog of the rough North Atlantic Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC EXPLODES: WAGNER'S "GOTTERDAMMERUNG" (Twilight of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viking explorer LEIF ERICSON carefully studies his fob co he dangles it above a parchment map. His SAILORS steal ne looks at a large, diabolical-looking IRON BOX in the hold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLAF, a fierce, one-eyed Viking warrior approaches Ericso Dialog is in OLD NORSE, with SUBTITLES)

dialogues.speaker: OLAF
dialogues.text: Leif, let's do the deed before another night falls. The crew's near mutiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ericson draws his broadsword with a flourish.

dialogues.speaker: LEIF ERICSON
dialogues.text: Know this! The first man to turn will taste my steel in his guts.

dialogues.speaker: OLAF
dialogues.text: But we've surely gone far enough.

dialogues.speaker: ERICSON
dialogues.text: That accursed box must be thrown off the edge of the world. We will go until we can go no more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is an ear-splitting SCREECH and the entire rocks violently as it runs aground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LOOKOUT is thrown from his crow's nest... and CRASHES straight through the deck right in front of Ericson. His voice floats up  from the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKOUT
dialogues.text: ...Land ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ericson wheels about just as the fog parts off the starbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful rustic coastline stretching off as far as the see.

dialogues.speaker: LEIF
dialogues.text: (GASPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Odin's beard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olaf finishes digging a hole in the sand. He backs away,  terrified, as burly Vikings, led by Ericson, muscle the I over to the hole and  quickly bury it. Ericson turns to an exotic-looking Euras WITCH.

dialogues.speaker: ERICSON
dialogues.text: Be quick, Witch. Let the deed be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Witch unravels a scroll and recites:

dialogues.speaker: WITCH
dialogues.text: Oh Loki, ancient one. Thy mischief dwell now in waters, base and bland. And in waves and sand thy magic forever sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Witch speaks, a strong wind kicks up and a black w clouds appears. The sky explodes in THUNDER and LIGHTNING

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: look about fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: ERICSON, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Back to the ship men, hurry.

dialogues.speaker: OLAF
dialogues.text: Captain, you've discovered a new world. It is your right to name it.

dialogues.speaker: ERICSON
dialogues.text: Leave that to the Italians. We're never coming back here. Never. This land is now cursed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot, smoggy and packed. Cityscape of towering skyscrapers in the haze just beyond the crowded beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caffeine-driven D.J's voice booms over the beach-goers'

dialogues.speaker: D.J., (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yessiree, it's a four-alarm sizzler out there today with highs in the upper nineties and no relief in sight. We have a third stage smog advisory and a metro traffic gridlock alert. Flourocarbons are up, the Dow Jones is down and we're expecting another Spike Lee movie any second. In other words folks, it's just another bee-youtiful day in Edge City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera ENDFRAMES on an industrial barge marked "Departmen Sanitation." A crane's cable line disappears underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCUBA WELDERS repair a cracked, scum spewing pipe. One di something hard with his dredger. He unearths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rust and barnacles partially obscure the engraved images gods and demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DIVER wedges his scuba knife under the corroded lock. 'MASK' theme SFX rise as he tries to pry open the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the PIPELINE BREAKS FREE, crushing the diver and cracking open the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMETHING (seen only in rippling shadow) explodes out of on a cloud of bubbles and shoots toward the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask surfaces in the f.g. as lightening EXPLODES acro distant cityscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner displays their proud motto: "WE BANK ON TOMORROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE SCHUMACHER (30's) gazes out the window from his c desk as the crack of THUNDER echos through the urban cany

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Look at those clouds rollin' in, man. Freaky weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANLEY IPKISS, a bright0eyed amiable young account exec by Charlie's desk and drops off a print-out.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hey Charlie, can you go over these stats? We're supposed to have a complete report before lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie takes one looks at the complex print-outs and tos back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Woah. Sorry Stanley, I just had my weave tightened and my head is killing me. Be a pal and take those over to Hinkleman, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGGIE, a cute young blonde now strolls by.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Hi guys. Did you have any luck with those concert tickets Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley perks up at the sight of her.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I sure did. Friday night, just like you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Stanley, that's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What time should I pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Gee, I don't know. My best girlfriend just got into town and I know she'd love to go. Can we get an extra ticket for her?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Well... uh, actually it's sold out. I was kinda lucky to get these.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: She's only going to be in town a couple of days and I just can't let her sit at home all alone. Are you sure there isn't something we can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley considers the situation for a moment, then pulls tickets out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You know what? Here. You two go.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh Stanley, I couldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No really. Go ahead. It's okay. I hate concerts anyway. All that, you know... music floating around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie snatches the tickets from Stanley's hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: That is so sweet. Sheila's just going to love this.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: So maybe you and I can get together over the weekend?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what's going on, but just give me a call. You know I like to be spontaneous.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Stanley Ipkiss, you are the nicest guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie gives him a quick air-kiss and hurries off to her window.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The kiss of death. As soon as they use the "N" word it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: So maybe I am a nice guy. So what?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You are a rug. I am talking astro-turf here. You're letting these women sharpen their cleats on you.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a gentleman. If they can't appreciate that, it's their problem.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You spend too much time being "nice" to a girl, you'll wind up sittin' around listening to her complain about the son of a bitch she really loves.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Charlie, you are a very sick puppy.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wake up, Stanley! These are the nineties. We're dealing with an entire generation of dysfunctional love junkies. You can't romance 'em. You gotta confuse 'em. It's the only thing that gets their attention. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me demonstrate. You see that girl over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks over at the coffee service where an attract young WOMAN is pouring herself a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Hi Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (forgets his name) Oh, hi...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: That's right. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Lisa, this may seem a little odd, but my friend over there and I were having this discusion and I thought maybe you could settle it for us.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I'll help out if I can.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (SHEEPISHLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I don't know... this is kind of a personal question.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: That's okay. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Alright. Just for the sake of argument, if I wasn't a happily married man... am I the kind of guy you'd go out with?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, um... I don't know. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... yeah. I guess I would.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Lisa, I have terrific news for you.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm not married! Is this perfect or what? Listen, there's not a lot of women willing to come right out like that and admit they're attracted to a guy, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa SLAPS Charlie, turns on her heel, and marches off.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Jeez... make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley gives Charlie the fish eye as he returns.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Bad example. Some of these women got so much baggage they need an emotional sky cap. I'll tell you what Stanley, tonight I'm gonna take you on a love safari, deep into the darkest heart of the urban jungle.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: And where's that?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The Monkey's Paw. Hottest new club in town. It's a guaranteed skirt alert and no dead beats allowed.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: So how are we gonna get in?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Woah, do I detect a little self-image problem there, buddy? You just leave everything to me. This, my friend is going to be the perfect night on the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a resounding peal of THUNDER rings out like the doom. Sheets of rain pour down on the bank's windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedestrians scramble for cover in the sudden downpour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young woman scurries into the bank holding a newspaper head. She's soaking wet and pauses in the foyer to straig herself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie immediately notices her...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hold the phone. Killer at three o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA does a classic CHEESECAKE TILT-UP starting with th woman's million dollar legs as she squeezes some of the w of her  skirt... up past her body, which through her damp summer is undeniable proof that there is a God... up... up... to face as that  newspaper is tossed aside. She's a heart-stopping woman/c with a Cupid's bow mouth and ice blue eyes. In other word trouble.  Big trouble, also known as TINA CARLYLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie may as well have just seen the Virgin of Guadalup

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (hushed reverence) Oh my god... A perfect dime. The dame of dames. The Moby of my dick.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Easy Charlie. You'll sprain your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina now enters and walks towards Stanley and Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where can I open a new account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie flashes his best 100 watt smile.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You've come to the right place, ma'am. Just step right this way and pull up a chair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie tries to steer Tina to his desk, but she's still  preoccupied with her damp clothing.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm a complete wreck. Will you hold this please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands her shoulder bag to Stanley and peels off her w blazer, creating another awe-inspiring visual moment.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Here, let me take that for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie clutches her jacket with white knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tina turns and sits at Stanley's desk; Charlie is stu his near miss, but there's not a thing he can do about it

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: So, uh, what kind of account did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (smiles sweetly) Well, I'm not sure exactly. I'm just terrible with things like that. That's an interesting tie Mr...?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Ipkiss. Stanley Ipkiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Tina Carlyle. Pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: The, uh... pleasure's all mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina notices a box of Kleenex on Stanley's desk.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: May I? I'm such a mess.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh... of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina takes out a compact and daintily blots the moisture face.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: As I was saying about that tie. It's like one of those, what do you call them, ink blot tests.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: A Rorschach test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She twists open a tube of lip gloss andbegins to run it a her incredibly lush liips.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: That's it. It looks like... um. A young woman riding bareback. You know, like a Lady Godiva or something.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Really? I don't think I can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly runs a finger along Stanley's tie.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Or... if that's not a horse it could be two lovers. A man and a woman. That would be the woman on top, of course.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (MESMERIZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She licks her lips and blots them on the Kleenex, leaving perfect kiss impression and drops it on Stanley's desk.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: What do you see, Mr. Ipkiss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley starts to get uncomfortable under her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I don't know. ...Bold colors. It's a power tie, y'know? They're supposed to make you feel... powerful.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Does it work?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Sort of. It's just a tie. Now, about that account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tina drops her compact back in her shoulder bag and we flick a red L.E.D. light on. She carefully adjusts the ba aiming a tiny  CAMERA LENS neatly concealed within it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: That's it sweetheart. A little to the right.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: That's cool, man. Freeze it right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian punches a button and the image freezes.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: What do you think, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: Layout's not bad. We got us a sweet little Perkins/Jenning time lock. But them motion detectors are putting the chill on my thrill.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Can you pull it off?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: Hey, you're talkin' with the Doctah, man. It's all about time and money.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well the meter's runnin' on this one. We got less than a week.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: Not cool. What about the coin?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: There's plenty. And I'll be happy to invest your share.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: What you talkin' about, man?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: This isn't about the lousy couple hundred thou' that's sitting in that vault, Freeze. That's chump change.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Then I'm chump number one, man.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: We gotta expand your horizons Doctor. Take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian pulls back a curtain. An amazingly gaudy building on a pier across the river from Dorian's club. A huge sig it's archway  reads: "Opening Soon Valhalla Casino".

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: The Valhalla Casino. Twenty mil of glass, neon, booze and dice. World class sucker bait. The grand opening is Saturday night and it will drive this two bit club of mine out of existence. But I say if you can't beat 'em, take 'em over.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: Yeah? That's Arnie the Swede's place, man and he is one ice cold meatball eatin' motha fucker.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Leave him to me. You pull off this heist and I promise you, it'll be all tits and champagne from here on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask lies tangled in a rat's nest of seaweed and garb that's washed up in a culvert under a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large WHARF RAT now creeps out along the garbage sniffi curiously at its timeworn wooden surface. It takes a tent nibble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begins to SHIMMER... to vibrate with its own magical inne The rat SQUEAKS and jumps back, disturbing the pile of ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley and Charlie are riding along at breakneck speed i cab.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hold it up right here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun port suddenly SLAMS open and the wild-eyed Albanian DRIVER wheels about and cocks a huge .45 from his side of

dialogues.speaker: BULLET
dialogues.text: riddled partition as the cab continues to barrel through

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hold up?! No hold up! I keel you very well! I splatter your guts big time, Mr. Cowboy Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley dives for cover.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No! No! He only wants you to stop the cab!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver instantly SLAMS on the brakes, throwing his pa forward mercilessly.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (now totally calm) Hokay. Pardon you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie helps Stanley sit back up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's alright, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this town. I really hate this town.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why are you getting out here?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I gotta pick up my car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Fine. Now don't forget. Ten o'clock at the Monkey's Paw. I've already got us lined up with a couple of authentic dimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley steps out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Charlie, please. The last time you said that you showed up with two lesbian mud-wrestlers.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Well, I can't promise we'll get that lucky again... Later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a SCREAM of tires the cab peels back out into traffi

dialogues.text: Stanley enters the grease spattered, cluttered garage and the area for signs of life. We can hear the CLANK-CLANK-C

dialogues.speaker: SOME
dialogues.text: less than light-fingered automotive work in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley DINGS a little service bell sitting on a counter  plastered with naked playmate decoupage and Mrs. Power To calendars.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: ...Hello?

dialogues.text: IRV, a lumbering unshaven behemoth of a man with permanen slung refrigerator repairman pants, makes his way past ha rebuilt car  carcasses towards Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Hang on. Hong on. Don't get your panties in a twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT, a thinner version of Irv with Coke bottle glasses a of greasy hair, pops up from beneath a car, RIPS out of c motor and  wiring and holds it up to Irv.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (examining part) Hey Irv, what the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: (eyes it carefully) Ohh... I dunno. About seven hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh evilly as Irv slaps Burt on the back. Irv his way over to Stanley, still chuckling to himself.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Now what can I do for you, Bub?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I'm here for the Civic.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Japanese car, right? Kind of a nasty pea soup green?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Well, they call it Emeral Forest, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv turns back to Burt.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Burt! Pea green Civic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt pops back up from beneath the hood.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Green Civic... Green Civic. Oh yeah! Brake drums are still on order and I'm only halfway through rebuilding the trans.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: But I just brought it in for an oil change!

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well you're lucky we caught those other problems before they caused some serious trouble.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright. When will it be ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv looks over at Burt, who gives him a "Make something u

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Come back tomorro... (Burt shakes his head "no".) ...First thing next wee... (Burt shakes again) ...next month? (Burt shakes an enthusiastic "yes".) Yeah, first thing next month. That's if we can get the parts.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What am I going to do in the meantime? I can't afford to keep taking cabs all over town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv smiles a rotten-toothed smile.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Oh, hell... we can take care of that! (to Burt archly) Hey Burt, bring around the loaner. (to Stanley) And for you little buddy, only ten bucks a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The joint is jumping with musclehead BOUNCERS picking and choosing from the crowd of terminally trendy WANNABE'S ga around the  entrance. A light drizzle is falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glistening pearlescent Rolls Royce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire engine red Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A classic two tone Corniche in tan and burgundy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally a broken down Citroen in rust bucket red and gray RUMBLES up to the front of the club with a disgruntl Stanley behind  the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car hop attempts to open the door, but it's rusted shut Stanley throws his shoulder into it and the door finally open with a SCREECH of  metal. Stanley nearly tumbles out into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles nervously at a high class couple looking with d at the eyesore-mobile. He pats the hood.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: It's a classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car hop jumps in and tries to throw the car into gear horrible GRINDING. He finally waves over two other car ho quickly push  it off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Stanley. Nice wheels. What is that, a Rolls Canardley?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You know, a Rolls Canardley. Rolls down one hill canardley roll up the next. (he cracks up)

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: We are not discussing the car, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gestures expansively towards the club.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What do you think? Pretty terrific, huh? This place make Sodom and Gomorrah look like Mayberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley now notices a life-sized poster of Tina Carlyle s by the main entrance that reads "Featuring the Musical St of Miss Tina  Carlyle."

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, isn't that...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right. The wet dream from the bank. (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on... I think I see my future ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two rather tacky looking GIRLS beckon Charlie from the cr

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Hey Charlie! Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (WAVES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in luck. It's Barbie and Pebbles.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Doesn't it bother you that all the women you know are named after cartoon characters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbie and Pebbles hurry over through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: We've been waiting out here for hours. Can you get us in?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, problemo. Ladies, this is my pal Stanley Ipkiss. (leans closer) Stanley's very influential in the banking business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is truly in his element as he elbows his way thro crowd dragging his entourage with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie finally makes through the crush of badies at the way's velvet ropes and calls to one of the two hulking BO that guard the  door.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey Bobby! Bobby, buddy. What's happening man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby completely ignores Charlie as he ushers a pasty fac STAR and his underage TARTLET past the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (to the girls) This will just take a second. (to the other bouncer) Yo Nick! It's me... Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is also completely oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Forget it, Charlie. I refuse to stand here waiting to be judged by these power-mad steroid jockeys.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How much cash you got on you?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You heard me. How much you got?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I dunno, fifty or sixty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hand it over.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll pay you back! I'm only carrying plastic. C'mon man, you want to stand out here all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley begrudgingly starts to count out some cash. Charl snatches the whole wad and elbows his way back around to ropes.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (subtly flashing bills) Hey Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's uncanny tip radar suddenly lights up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Charlie, how you doin' man? Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby unsnaps the rope for Charlie and gets the cash hand longs for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd surges around Charlie, Barbie and Pebbles as th by, briefly cutting Stanley off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches up just as the all-important rope is SNAPPED c

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute! Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Charlie and the girls have already been whisked insid Dorian now steps out of the club and begins to check Bobb list.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: I'm with them! Hey, Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bobby is back into his deaf and dumb routine. Stanley the rope himself and starts throgh. Bobby and BOUNCER #2

dialogues.speaker: IMMEDIATELY
dialogues.text: grab Stanley and quickly subdue him.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hey! Leggo... awk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian glares at Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Lose him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bouncers drag Stanley through the crowd and unceremon toss him out into the rain-slick street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley slowly rises, smoothing out his disheveled clothi horn BLARES and Stanley scrambles to one side as a limo s into the  club's alleyway, splattering him with a wave of muddy wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley wipes the mud from his eyes just in time to see T Carlyle escorted from the back of the limo by a CHAUFFEUR carrying an umbrella.  She's shoe-horned into a heart-stopping red dress that's a losing battle to restrain her decolletage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their EYES MEET. Tina pauses as she recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Stanley. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley realizes he looks ridiculous but gives a pathetic wave hello anyway.

dialogues.speaker: TINA, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley gestures "no problem" and tries to strike a casua against a street lamp, but slips and nearly falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a SQUEAL of grinding gears and the KA-POW of a backf car hop pulls Stanley's battered loaner right up behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley flashes a last nervous smile at Tina, and digs fo car hop's tip money... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs apologetically to the disgusted car hop and cli The car RATTLES, COUGHS the finally ROARS off in a cloud

dialogues.speaker: NOXIOUS
dialogues.text: exhaust fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forlorn looking spot on the outskirts of Edge City. We Stanley's car SPUTTERING and POPPING along before it actu pulls into  sight on the dark rain-slick street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley drives along in a miserable daze. Suddenly the en starts KNOCKING violently and the car dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam HISSES from the radiator as the car slowly rolls to Stanley GRINDS the ignition key again and again trying fu to restart the  engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Stanley fights his way out of the rusted door wi SQUEAL of metal, turns and kicks the bumper... which prom falls off with a  resounding CLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front axle collapses, the tires fall off and the driv side door CLATTERS to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley stands there staring at the steaming heap of usel metal... his mind a complete blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly turns, looking down at the black brackish water swirling along beneath the Tahoochie Bridge. A wave of me sweeps over  him. Stanley plucks a button from his coat and watches as drops down... down to the river below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, something catches Stanley's eye... a BODY, floa along in the darkness. He snaps back to reality.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Hey... Hey mister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rushes down the slippery embankment beneath the b He spots the body dead ahead, floating along in the moonl

dialogues.speaker: HURRIES
dialogues.text: as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DOLLIES with Stanley as he scrambles down the slop black cat YOWLS as it races past him. He steps on and sha discarded mirror, and he ducks under an old ladder that l against the bridge's foundation as he finally reaches the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley splashes into the waist deep water just in time t the body as it floats by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Stanley grabs it, the "body" falls to pieces... reveal it's nothing but a trash bag, an old tire and some floati of garbage all  clinging to the "head": an old wooden Mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley shakes his head in disgust... some lifesaver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley inspects the Mask more closely; strange ritualist symbols carved into a puckish face with a leering grin an empty eye holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faintest sound of a haunting "Mask SFX Theme" rises a Stanley turns the Mask around and inspects the inside... bringing it  closer and closer to his face. The surface of the Mask be SHIMMER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then... RIBET! A frog jumps out of it, right into Sta face. Stanley nearly loses his footing on the slippery ri bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a blinding SPOTLIGHT shines down from the bridge amplified voice calls out from a squad car.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, you! What are you doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley squints into the light, trying to think of a reas answer.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I was just looking for... (holds up Mask) My mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is closing up. WAITERS stack chairs on top of ta the B.G. as Tina gathers her sheet music from her PIANIST

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Thanks Reno, you're the greatest.

dialogues.speaker: RENO
dialogues.text: G'night, doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina crosses to the bar area where Dorian lounges with DR FREEZE, SWEET EDDY and CHUN WOO. Dorian toasts her as she up a bar  stool.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: That was a great performance, baby. But not as great as the one you pulled off at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well don't get used to it. I'm not going to start running cons for you again, Dorian. I'm a singer now and that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian rolls his eyes at Freeze, "Get her".

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, really? And you had such a red hot career before you latched on to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina pours herself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Who latched on to who?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Get real, Tina. You'll do what I say or I'll drop you back where I found you, slingin' hash and dodgin' horny peterbuilt drivers.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (downs a shot) Don't push me, Nicky. I might just take a walk I should have taken a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: (CHUCKLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, baby. Easy. (to his men) I love it when she gets pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian scoots over and puts an arm around Tina. She remai

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: C'mere. You take a hike and who's gonna kiss you like Dorian Tyrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina pours another shot.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: C'mon. Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina finally cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: (pulls her close) That's right, baby. C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina slowly leans in for a kiss, her lips softly parted.. raises a finger to Dorian's lips, stopping him cold. She over at Freeze.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Sorry. I never get personal in front of the help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina abruptly stands and exits as Freeze glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian breaks into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: That broad kills me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FREEZE
dialogues.text: She just might, man. The bitch is trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian pours them all a drink.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: C'mon Doctor, lighten up. (raises his glass) Here's to Edge City Bank. May it crack like an egg on Easter Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their glasses CLINK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car pulls up in front of Stanley's brownstone wearily climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Okay, Mr. Ipkiss. Try to be a little more careful next time.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Thanks Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black and white pulls away and Stanley starts across empty street.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A razor-cut DEATH'S HEAD PUNKER hops down from a fire esc darkened alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: You a cop or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen other DEATH'S HEADS appear out of the shadow decked out in nipple chains, tattoos and other self-mutil

dialogues.speaker: AS-FASHION
dialogues.text: oddments.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Uh... no. They just gave me a lift.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: A cop chauffeur? I never seen that before. How about you boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Death's Heads pipe up with "Not Me," "Nope," "P special," etc. as they slowly surround Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Alright, you guys. It's been a tough night. I haven't got any money. I haven't got a car. All I have is this and you're welcome to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley tosses Death's Head #1 the Mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He briefly inspects the funky looking antique, still slic river slime, then tosses it back. He approaches Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey, man. You got us all wrong. We don't want any trouble. I was just going to ask you for the time. That's all. You got the time?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Stanley pulls back his sleeve to check his watch, the Head flicks out a butterfly knife. With a FLASH of steel, slices straight  through Stanley's watch band and snatches the watch.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: (holding up his prize) See, I only wanted the time! Heh, he, heh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the punkers laugh like the half-wits they are as Deat #1 shoves Stanley into Death's Head #2. #2 pushes him bac to #3 and  so on. Stanley is roughly bounced back and forth more and violently within the circle of giggling street toughs. He breaks free and  scrambles to his front door, still reeling with dizziness fumbles with the key and SLAMS the door behind him as the Heads roar with  laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's wet shoes SQUEAK as he tiptoes past -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign that reads "Quiet Please" hangs from the doorknob. continues past it to Apartment "B". Just as he removes hi

dialogues.speaker: THE
dialogues.text: Manager's door flies open and MRS. PEENMAN appears. She's dragon in hair curlers who will probably live forever jus spite her  relatives.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEENMAN
dialogues.text: Ipkiss! Do you have any idea what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reflexively, he looks at his (now empty) wrist.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Actually, no.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEENMAN
dialogues.text: It's three o'clock in the morning! First, you wake up the entire building laughing it up with your pals. Then, you come in and start squeak - (sees puddles) My new carpet! Just look at that! This is coming out of your cleaning deposit Ipkiss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, battered, bruised and soaking wet is deep in urb shell-shock.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you done?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEENMAN
dialogues.text: ...Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I think I'll be going to bed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peenman SLAMS her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, full of books but very neat. A few cherished anima cels from 1940s cartoons are framed on the wall. As Stanl the door behind  him - he's greeted by MILO, a happy little terrie sized m a big heart.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hello, Milo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo gets so excited he starts GAGGING and COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Easy, buddy. I missed you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pats Milo on the rump, crosses his tiny kitchenet heads straight into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's prized collection of "golden Age" Looney Tunes are neatly displayed on a simple bookshelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the Mask down on his bedside table, pops one of cherished Tex Avery cartoons into the V.C.R., plops down bed and  starts to strip off his shoes and socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters, holding a Frisbee in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: C'mon, Milo. I'm beat. (to the dog YIPS) Okay, okay. One throw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley tosses the Frisbee into the air. The disk sails..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo runs it down, leaps up, and makes a perfect catch. H back to the bedroom, and drops it in Stanley's lap.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Easy. This is the best part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen a cartoon dog ZZZIPS into frame and drops a frizzing stick of dynamite down a bad guy's pants. KA-BOO dog LAUGHS  maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a POUNDING on the wall that rattles Sta framed cartoon cels.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (calls out) Sorry Mrs. Peenman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sigh, he ejects the tape and a much quieter talk s on. Larry King and a guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rises and crosses into the bathroom to wash up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King's guest, Dr. Arthur Neuman, is replying to a caller.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: That's correct. The truth is we all wear masks, metaphorically speaking. We repress the Id... our darkest desires and hide behind a more socially acceptable image of ourselves in order to cope with the frustrations of our day to day lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's only half listening though the open bathroom do brushes his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Think I'm repressed, Milo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley tries a couple of fierce expressions in the bathr mirror, his mouth foaming with toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo does that doggie-head-cocked-sideways "What the hell

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (HALF-HEARTEDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spits and rinses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as King wraps it up, displaying the doctor's book.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY KING
dialogues.text: The book is "The Masks We Wear," by Dr. Arthur Neuman. Thank you Dr. Neuman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pops off the T.V.with his remote.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No thank you, Dr. Neuman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he buttons up his P.J.s, Stanley notices Milo warily s at the strange Mask, which is still lying on the bedside

dialogues.speaker: SUBTLE
dialogues.text: SHIMMER crosses its surface. Milo WHIMPERS and quickly ho the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now begin to hear the "Mask Theme"... echoes of the PO Viking drums... growing louder. Haunting whispery VOICES call to Stanley as he slowly crosses to the bedside. He p the Mask and turns it over in his hands running his finge across the time  work wood. The music builds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the bathroom mirror and slowly raises th to his face. Milo watches apprehensively from beneath the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant - the MASK SHRINK WRAPS like a vacuum over Stanley's head. We hear the PIERCING MASK SFX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a beat later, the Mask is off with a POP. The SFX S

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley studies the old mask, then his own face in the mi Everything's status quo. It must have been his imaginatio

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Naw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the Mask on again - firmly this time. Milo dives the bed as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUBBERY WOODEN WHIPS shoot out of the Mask and wrap aroun Stanley's head - locking the Mask in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANLEY'S PAJAMAS magically reweave themselves... growing directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS HEAD THROBS AND EXPANDS, turning lime green as it uni the Mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANLEY GRABS HIS HEAD - His body begins to move uncontro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning faster and faster like a gyroscope. The SFX get and loonier as he becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUMAN TORNADO. Stanley's words are almost unintelligibl voice jumps one, two, five octaves.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hellllllllppppmmmmmmmeeeeeeeee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND reaches out of the twister and locks onto the bedp whirlwind SCREECHES to a halt, causing sparks and smoke t

dialogues.speaker: FROM
dialogues.text: the singed carpet. The smoke clears revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dressed in a snazzy zoot suit - a distortion of the material of Stanley's pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head is no longer Stanley's. It's large, bald and bri green. The huge bug-eyes glow with mischief. The nose is bony and beaked.  The mouth and teeth are enormous and gleaming white as he into a learning grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The overall effect is devilishly loony, but not altogethe unhuman. In fact, there's something downright charming ab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask checks himself out in the mirror and likes what

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK
dialogues.text: S-s-s-nazzy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SNAPS his bow tie with a crazy gleam in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: It's party time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to ber VERY, VERY quiet, the Mask tiptoes down the darkened corridor. The floor makes a barely audible CREEE the Mask steps  with exaggerated care pst APARTMENT "A" with it's little Please" sign. He raises a finger to his lip, making the " sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly - and unexplicably - a ringing ALARM CLOCK leaps Stanley/Mask's pocket and starts jittering down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: O, jeepers--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask tries to snag the clock, but it bounces away time. Frustrated, he pulls a full sized SLEDGEHAMMER from pocket and  starts POUNDING the floor in an effort to stop the clock. Glancing blows shatter the clock face and most of the wor those bells just keep  ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hammer, of course, slams craters the size of manhole into the floor and reverberates through the building like THUNDERBOLTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open and Mrs. Peenman's angry face pops o covered in blue mud pack and framed in curlers. She gets at the Mask  with his oversized carnival mallet raised over his head a SCREAMS bloody murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask SCREAMS in response, his eyes bugging out on sta his mouth expanding to the size of a tuba in mock horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peenman's door SLAMS shut and reopens a beat later a appears cocking an enormous shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: Easy lady! I was just killin' time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask starts ricocheting off the walls HOOTING maniaca laughter as Mrs. Peenman lets loose with both barrels. KA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask bounces off walls as Mrs. Peenman continues to b away, and finally leaps straight out the window. KEE-RASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sending his body SAILING our through the air towards the seven stories below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLAT. Stanley/Mask lands face up in the middle of the st slow... painfully starts to rise as a STREET CLEANING mac turns a  corner and RUNS DIRECTLY OVER HIM. The machine disappears the street as we HOLD on Stanley/Mask's flattened body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises one arm, grabs himself by the head and peels hi off the street. He shakes himself out with one sharp CRAC straightens his  zoot suit. He's shocked to find a tiny SPOT on his sleeve

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: Hey! You missed a spot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if on cue, a SECOND street cleaning machine SLAMS into RUNS OVER HIM AGAIN. This time he reinflates himself back

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: by blowing into his thumb and hops up.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: And next time, no starch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully recovered, Stanley/Mask starts down the street, str like a prize fighter.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death's Head punker #1 hops down from his fire esscape be Mask.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: (grins evilly) ...You got the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask turns to see he is surrounded by the Death's Hea punkers. He seems to be delighted by their presence, but they see his  face, they're totally freaked.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: (wiggles eyebrows) Why of course, Cubbie. I got all the time in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips out his forearm (which grows large for emphasis style). It's covered with crazily spinning watches, CHIMI cuckoo clocks  and sun dials.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: London, Paris, Rome, standard, substandard and no standards at all! And for our English friends we have... Big Ben!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Big Ben?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask KICKS a nearby street post, snapping it in h sending a large decorative street clock PLUMMETING into t sidewalk.  KA-BONG! It completely obliterates Death's Head #1. The o gang members jump back in shock as the Mask races around corner.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Death's Heads pull out nasty homemade weapons and rac the corner into the alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a screeching halt as they discover Stanley/M dressed as a carnival barker. Multicolored lights and Cal music come from  out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: And for my next trick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pink and blue balloons appear in Stanley/Mask's hand instantly goes into a frenzy of twisting and knotting the

dialogues.speaker: AN
dialogues.text: elaborate balloon sculpture. SQUEAK. SQUEAK. SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Death's Heads are too stunned by the severe weirdness this to do anything but stand there and stare. (These guy no rocket  scientists in the first place.)

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: And viola! We have a giraffe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, he's created a first rate balloon sculpture. hands it to the biggest, dumbest Death's Head, who grins little kid upon  receiving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask instantly goes into another flurry of motion, sc more balloons. SCREECH POP.

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: A few more twists of the wrist and for you, Cubbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands this next prize to Death's Head #3.

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: A French poodle! And finally my favorite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into another flurry of motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Mask pulls the ends of the knotted balloon, it str out and MORPHS into...

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: A Tommy gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real one! He immediately sprays the Death's Heads with lead. RATATATATATAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The greasy punkers dive for cover and scramble out of the under a hail of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask tosses the gun aside, intoxicated with his n powers.

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. This is incredible! Why, with these powers I could be a superhero! I could fight crime... Work for world peace...

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: But first!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, but there's still a light on inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Irv, both woozy from drink, attempt to finish a game. A dozen empty beer bottles and two half eaten chili adorn the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv takes a big bite of his chili dog and pauses to regar like a true connoisseur.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Now these are serious chili dogs.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I know. Here's the proof... (lets out a long BUUURP) Aaah. Even tastier the second time around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv leans forward and sticks out his index finger.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Hey Burt, pull on my finger.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: No way, man.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: No, really. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Irv, don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv raises a leg anyway and rips off a nasty fart. BRAAAP

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: (PROUDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, my friend is the sweet smell of success.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No style. I give it a five tops.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Okay, how about... Soprano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv shifts his weight and hits an amazing high note. PWEE Burt is impressed in spite of himself.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Fine muscle control.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: And now for my grand finale, THX... The audience is listening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv lets one loose in perfect sensurround.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the front door EXPLODES inward. Stanley/Mask sta there SILHOUETTED like a gunfighter from a Clint Eastwood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv squints into the light, unable to make out the myster figure.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Hey, 40 watt... we're closed! Nobody's here.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: Ah... but you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv rises.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: What I mean is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets loose a sneaker to help make his point. POOOOT.

dialogues.speaker: IRV
dialogues.text: Nobody's here that wants to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask now steps into the light.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: But I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Irv's eyes go wide as they get a better look at nemesis. Fear loosens Irv's sphincter and a last feeble b gas escapes with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask whirls about with a flourish and pulls two g mufflers from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MASK
dialogues.text: Sounds like you have a little exhaust problem there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a mad gleam in his eyes as he spins the mufflers huge pistols and SNAPS them to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: We better do a few touch ups before you have some serious trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask TWIRLS out of frame like a human tornado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera PUSHES IN past Burt and Irv's shocked expressions E.C.U. of the garage's bare light bulb as it JIGGLES on i We can't see the mayhem, but we can hear wacky/bizarre so as the Mask whirls about the garage. WHIZ! SCREECH! BANG!

dialogues.speaker: BURT AND IRV
dialogues.text: No!... Wait! Eeeeeyaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As that light bulb becomes the morning SUN peaking over E City's skyline. CAMERA PULLS BACK through Stanley's bedro window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley slowly awakens. He grabs his head and moans, look feeling completely hung over. Then suddenly he remembers

dialogues.speaker: JUMPS
dialogues.text: out of bed with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in the mirror, touching his face. It's the same Stanley. He looks at his paisley PJ's. Same old PJ's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the mask. Same old mask.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: A dream... It was only a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley starts to relax. There's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's greeted by LT. KELLAWAY (50). This hound-dog of can't help but stare at Stanley's garish pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Nice PJ's pal.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You're Ipkiss? Stanley Ipkiss?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Some kind of prowler broke in and attacked Mrs. Peenman.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (swallows hard) Really? I didn't hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Then you must be a pretty sound sleeper, Ipkiss 'cause she unloaded a couple rounds of 20 ott buckshot five feet from your door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway swings Stanley's door open wider to give him a b view of the damage. Mrs. Peenman stands there in the hall tearfully speaking to  anither OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is flabbergasted to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. - The shotgun blasts in the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. - The pot holes left from the mallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. - The shattered remains of the wacky alarm clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All flashbacks from last night!

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (GASPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... impossible!

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley quickly pulls himself together.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: That's... a, possible. See, I have this inner ear problem. (wiggles a finger in his ear vigorously) Sometimes I can't hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: (SKEPTICAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a fact?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway leans closer to speak more loudly, but catches h and shoots Stanley a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Stanley his card.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Here. You remember anything unusual about last night, anything at all, call me.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Sure... thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley SLAMS the door and throws his body against it, hi pounding in his chest. Milo gives him that curious  dog-head-cocked-sideways look.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Milo, it was real! How could it all be... real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley suddenly notices the clock on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Oh my god. I'm late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway is taking notes as patiently as he can from Mrs. Peenman.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Look, Mrs. Peenman, you gotta admit your description is pretty tough to swallow.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEENMAN
dialogues.text: Then you can choke on it for all I care. I saw what I saw.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Right. (refers to notes) A green head the size of a pumpkin, purple zoot suit and spats. That's a pretty serious fashion risk for any self-respecting second story man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER now hurries up the steps all out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Lt., we just got an emergency call from a mechanic on 67th Street.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Some kind of assault and battery. Sound pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Dont' worry Mrs. Peenman, we'll find this guy for you. Officer Deluca here has a few forms you'll have to fill out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rushes around the apartment, but he can't find hi anywhere. He finishes tying his tie as he searches.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Milo! Keys! Keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo's ears prick. He leaps up and immediately starts sni around. He pulls a cushion off the sofa and emerges with just as Stanley  comes out, briefcaase in hand.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pets his dog, takes his keys and starts out the door.. pauses to take a last look at the mask... It's eerie blac holes and devilish  grin seem to mock him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On sudden impulse, he grabs it, hurls it out the balcony' sliding glass door and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailing end over end through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the mask flies out into the sir, a sudden wind kicks u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mask arcs back toward the building like a boomerang a balanced precariously on a narrow ledge. Its mocking grin to glow  with triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place looks like it's been hit by cartoon graffiti  guerrillas: Everything's printed in polka-dots, checks, t etc. The  "Ripley Auto Finishing" sign hangs askew over the doorway Letters have been sprayed out to read "Rip Off!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several REPORTERS and curious ONLOOKERS stand nearby as K and his men take it all in. PARAMEDICS appear wheeling Bu Irv out of the building on two gurneys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both in severe discomfort and look more like cars men: Bodies spray painted metallic colors, hood ornaments to their  foreheads, wire rims under each limb, and gleaming four f mufflers sticking out of their rear ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wince in pain at each tiny bump of the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: BURT AND IRV
dialogues.text: Ah!... Eeeh!... Ooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedic #3 speaks into his emergency radio-phone as Bur Irv are loaded into the van.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: I want a proctologist standing by! Yeah, you heard me! The best one you can find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER steps out of the building and approaches Kella

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We were able to get a description Lt., but it's pretty weird.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess... Big green head. Zoot suit.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: How did you...

dialogues.speaker: KELLWAY
dialogues.text: Whoever this guy is, he's a world class twisto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEGGY BRANDT, an attractive young woman in her mid twenti appears besides the other reporters and approaches Kellaw notepad in  hand.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Lt., I'm with the Evening Star. Can you tell me what happened here?

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Too early to comment.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: It looks like some kind of mob scare tactic.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: I said no comment. Now break it up. This is a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the officers disperse the reporters and other onlooker slips away from the group. Even though it's closed off wi yellow police  tape, Peggy slips inside the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty garage has been turned into a topsy-turvy night The same cartoon paint job covers the walls. Peggy looks

dialogues.speaker: SIFTING
dialogues.text: through some papers scattered all over the floor. Nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she spies the COMPLAINT BOX. Peggy opens it and pull HANDFUL of pink "comment" slips. She looks at them. Almos them are from one customer - STANLEY IPKISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, still looking rumpled and unshaven, hurriedly ta his coat and powers up his computer. Charlie steps over t desk carrying a  newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What happened to you last night? The girls and I were looking all over for you.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I uh, didn't feel so good. I decided to go home early.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, you don't look so good. You got to take better care of yourself, man.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: How was the club?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? It was hotter than a pistol. Did you see the paper?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Your girlfriend got a great review.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chralie flips open the Entertainment section of the Eveni There's a great close-up of Tina singing her heart out wi

dialogues.speaker: HEADLINE
dialogues.text: "Bombshell Explodes at Monnkey's Paw."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. DICKEY, the smarmy office manager who is younger than Stanley, now appears.

dialogues.speaker: DICKEY
dialogues.text: Ipkiss! You're forty minutes late! Every time you do that you're robbing this bank of its time and money!

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Dicky. It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: DICKEY
dialogues.text: (snatches newspaper) If you weren't so busy ogling girlie pictures you'd get some work done around here.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Ah... She's a prospective client of Stanley's, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DICKEY
dialogues.text: (sudden attitude change) She is? Well... Next time she comes in see that you send her directly to my office.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Yes sir, Mr. Dickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickey tosses the paper back on Stanley's desk and marche through the bank.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Look at that little creep. If it wasn't for his daddy he'd be out somewhere shakin' down school kids for lunch money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley toys with the Kleenex that bears Tina's lipstick

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You think she ever will come back, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Who knows? Forget about her, Stanley. A dame like that is always looking for the B.B.D. The bigger better deal. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You don't know that. She's an artist. Maybe she's sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She can sense a guy's credit line at two hundred yards. Stanley, you need a girl you can depend on. Someone a little more down to earth... someone like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Peggy Brandt stops by a teller's window, looking sharp pretty in a blazer and jeans.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can you tell me where I can find Stanley Ipkiss?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Like her! Someone like her. (straightens tie) As a matter of fact I could use someone like her myself. (rises as Peggy approaches) Hel-lo there. May I be of some assistance?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Stanley Ipkiss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie begrudgingly points to Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Peggy Brandt. I'm with the Evening Star.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, hi. I already have a subscription, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Oh no, actually I just wanted to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Really? About what?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Ripley Auto Finishing. You're a customer of theirs aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I... uh. No. I think you must have made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy produces one of the complaint slips.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Isn't this a form of theirs you filled out?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (nervous chuckle) Oh, that Ripley Auto. I guess I have stopped in there once or twice, Miss... what did you say your name was?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Peggy Brandt.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... Peggy Brandt of "Ask Peggy"?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (brightens up) You printed my letter last year, remember? "Nice Guys Finish Last."

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: You're Mr. Nice Guy? Stanley do you realize how much mail we got about that letter? There's hundreds of women out there who are looking for a man just like you.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Of course. DO you know how hard it is to find a decent man in this town? Most of them think monogamy is some kind of wood.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Why are you covering this story?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: They cut my salary. I just can't make it by on "Dear Peggy" anymore. The truth is, I want to be a real reporter and if I can break this story I know they'll let me. (sits closer) Look Stanley, I know Ripley Auto is a crooked operation. They may even have had ties to the Mob. I'm not out to get you. I just want the truth.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I wish I knew the truth, Peggy. I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well dressed MAN checks from beneath his sunglasses to nobody's watching and RAPS on the door. It opens and he q

dialogues.speaker: DISAPPEARS
dialogues.text: inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy escorts him inside. The man removes his glasse glances about nervously. Dorian sits at his desk. Dr. Fre Chun Woo  are going over an array of high tech burglary equipment l on the air hockey table.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Councilman Snell. Nice of you to drop by.

dialogues.speaker: SNELL
dialogues.text: Cut the crap. Dorian. What's so important that I had to come here in person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian gazes out the window to the Valhalla Casino.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: I got a little job for you, Tom. I want you to pull the Swede's gambling license.

dialogues.speaker: SNELL
dialogues.text: That's impossible. He was approved six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Pull a few strings. Find something in the fine print. I don't care how you do it, but do it. You owe me.

dialogues.speaker: SNELL
dialogues.text: (CHUCKLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you nothing, you little piece of shit. I got your liquor license when nobody else would touch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian suddenly EXPLODES, overturning his desk and sendin tumbling backwards. In less than a heartbeat, he grabs Sn his shirt  ffront, SLAMS him up against the wall, SMASHES a whiskey and presses the jagged edge to his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snell hangs there whimpering. Dorian has a crazed look in eyes as he gazes at the Councilman's lapel.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty. What is that, a carnation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snell nods. Dorian takes a deep whiff.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Nice. Hey, Eddy... call my florist. Two dozen pink carnations to Mrs. Snell with my regrets over her husband's untimely accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears begin to well up in Snell's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SNELL
dialogues.text: (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... please. I can do it. I can make it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian eases back... brushes off Snell's coat.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: That's smart. You're a very smart man. Now pull yourself together. Look at you.
