dialogues.text: As the police drag Dorian outside, Kellaway notices somet the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway picks up the slice of pajama fabric that was onc Mask's tie and inspects it closely... It's the same fabri Kellaway saw Stalney  wearing that morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway exits and walks right past the poster of Tina. F into the poster, with his arm around her, is a cartoon of Mask. The eyes  follow Kellaway as he speaks to TWO COPS guarding the doo

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You're on your own, boys.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Lt. If he's in there, well get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway slips the pajamas fabric in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: And if he's not, I got a feeling I know where to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kellaway heads for his car, the Mask slips out of the (still flat as a pancake), slides along the wall behind  unsuspecting policemen  and around the corner to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo GROWLS, Frisbee in mouth. Stanley wakes up with a ma headache and dark rings under his eyes. The Mask, which l the pillow  next to him is taking a greater and greater toll. There's BANGING on the door.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Police. Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley runs to the closet to hide the Mask. The instant the door, an avalanche of CASH pours out, suffocating him

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ipkiss! I know you're in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley grabs the Frisbee and starts shoveling the money into the closet. Now the doorbell starts RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: All right, I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley tosses the Mask and the Frisbee into the closet a it shut. He scoops up a few stray dollars and throws them the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries to the door and opens it, an easy smile on his

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, what a surprise! What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You can answer a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I've got to get ready for work.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Trust me. Your bank's opening late today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway steps into the apartment, without waiting for an invitation. Stanley glances nervously back at the closet. scratching at the door.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Where were you last night?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Here... mostly. Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Maybe, yes. Maybe, no. Maybe it's all just a crazy coincidence that this so called "Mask" character always seems to be wherever you are.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Mask -- who?

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Don't insult my intelligence, Ipkiss. First, he's spotted in your building, then the bank where you work and now I find this at the Monkey's Paw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He displays the TORN PIECE OF FABRIC. It matches the piec missing in Stanley's pajamas. Stanley wilts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo YAPS and leaps up, trying to open the closet door.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Milo. No! (moves the dog away) Okay, so I went out on the town last night. A guy's got to have a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: In your jammies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo is back at the closet door. He's just about got it o Stanley turns the detective to the door.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Naw, I just took 'em with me in case I didn't make it home. I don't know about you, Lieutenant. But I've got a pretty good track record with the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway pulls away from Stanley and begins suspiciously the air around him.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Wait a second... you smell that?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: (SNIFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I hate the smell of bullshit. Don't even think about leaving town, Ipkiss. I'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway SLAMS the front door, just as the closet door fa -- spilling all the cash. Milo happily snatches his Frisb Stanley sinks back  down on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do, Milo? What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A replay of the bank robbery, from the bank's grainy vide blurred image of the Mask is visible as he zig-zags aroun bank at high  speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway sips a cup of brackish coffee as Oliveras FREEZE the best image of the Mask. There's a wild-eyed look of g his face as  he stuffs sacks full of money.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY OLIVERAS
dialogues.text: I don't know, boss. That's one helluva rubber mask.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Where's the lab report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliveras hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY OLIVERAS
dialogues.text: We got fingerprints on some of the currency, but nothing matches Tyrel's men. Looks like this guy beat 'em to the punch.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Get the bank's employee files and run down the prints on a guy named Ipkiss.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY OLIVERAS
dialogues.text: You figure it was an inside job?

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, and all I need is a couple of prints to lock this wack job up 'till doomsday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian's assembled a war council. At the table are Sweet assorted Button Men from the city's underworld. An open a case filled  with stacks of money sits before Dorian.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: A fifty thousand dollar reward to the man who finds this "Mask" character before the cops do. Get the word out to every street hustler and low life in this town. (pounds his fist) I want him here. In my office. Alive. By tomorrow! Now get going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody scrambles out of their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina sits in the corner of the room, painting her nails. glances up at Dorian.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: You. You're losing it Dorian.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: I'm losing nothing. Except maybe some extra baggage I don't need around here.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: You weren't putting up much of a fight when that green goon kissed you last night.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: C'mon, did it look to you like I had a choice?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you did and maybe you didn't, but I know this, one day real soon I'm gonna run this town and when I do there's gonna be payback for anyone who crossed me. (glares at her) I mean anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is in general disarray but still functioning, j with worried depositors. Stanley makes his way to his des face pale and  unshaven. Dark circles ring his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DICKEY
dialogues.text: Ipkiss! We have a crisis on our hands here and you stroll in over an hour late. If I have to put up with your slovenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley develops an odd facial TWITCH, then...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (EXPLODES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off Monkey-Boy, before I tell your daddy how you're running this branch like it's your own personal piggy bank! If the I.R.S. saw some of those files we could arrange a little vacation for you at Club Fed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickey is absolutely shocked into silence by this outburs then...

dialogues.speaker: MR. DICKEY
dialogues.text: That will be all, Ipkiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickey turns on his heels and exits. Charlie Schumacher n appears glowing with new respect for Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Woah! What side of who's bed did you wake up on?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. (TWITCHES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't exactly been myself lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a split second, Stanley's entire face CONTORTS into a alarming Mask-like expression.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (WARILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you look like you could use a little R and R there buddy... and as a matter of fact I've got just the ticket. Or should I say tickets?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie flashes two tickets.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Saturday night. Grand opening of the Valhalla Casino. Serious skirt alert. Everybody who's anybody will be there. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: STANELY
dialogues.text: I don't know Charlie, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley suddenly spots Tina making her way across the roo desk.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me a second.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Tina... What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I heard about the robbery. I guess I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry about me. (TWITCHES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Are you sure? You look a little...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I'm just having a little trouble sleeping is all. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you won't want to open that account after all this...

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure I'll have much to open an account with anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What about the nightclub? I thought you were doing great.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I don't know how much longer I can stay there Stanley. Things are getting a little intense.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Well, there must be plenty of other places you could sing. Maybe even get a record deal...

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I wish it was that easy. There's thousands of girls out there just like me who...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Not just like you. You've got a voice like... like an angel.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (lights a cigarette) An angel huh? That's the first time I've heard that one.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No, I mean it. You really do.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I can vamp my way through a tune. But that's not really singing.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What is it with you, Tina? Why don't you believe in yourself?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I've just heard a lot of promises from a lot of guys. In the end they all wanted the same thing and it wasn't a song.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: So maybe you've been singing for the wrong guys.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure there's any other kind. Not for me, anyway. (RISES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad nobody got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: What about this guy, the Mask? Do the cops have a line on him?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. Why are you interested?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Promise you won't say anything?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: He came to the club last night and he was just so... well, different. I haven't been able to get him off my mind.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Really? They say he's pretty weird looking.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's ugly... but he's kinda cool... y'know, like Mick Jagger.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You really think so?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Yeah. If you hear anything about him, would you call me at the club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley nods - unsure of what to say. Tina opens the door before she exits...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Actually... I sort of know the guy.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: The Mask. We're - old college buddies him and I.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. To tell you the truth, I'm sorta covering for him on this bank thing. He's not such a bad guy, really. He just gets a little carried away.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'll say. Do you think you could give him a message?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Tell him I want to see him again

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: When? I mean, I'd need to tell him exactly.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: How about seven o'clock tonight at Peninsula Park.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I'll be... I mean, I'll make sure he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy parks her car in her space, locks it up and beeps o car horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she turns, she notices a shadowy FIGURE watching her bark corner of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries down the row of parked cars, clutching her pu her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure follows at a slow but relentless pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy fumbles for her keys, finally finds the correct one enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy is relieved as she reaches her apartment door and s key in the lock... but the lock is jammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries and tries again... nothing. Suddenly, a hand en frame and SLAPS an eviction notice on her door.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Sorry, doll. I had the locks changed this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: You what? You can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: You've known we're going condo for six months, Peggy. I can't stall the owner a minute longer. Either you pony up the downpayment or you're out.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Just a couple more days, Phil. The paper's ready to give me a full time job.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: I've heard that one before.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: C'mon, at least let me get a few of my things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil considers this a beat, then unlocks the door for her

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Don't make me regret this. We get a certified check by noon tomorrow or a Sheriff will escort you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Thanks Phil. You're a sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil exits. Peggy picks up her things when she hears an o camera "Pssst." She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands in the shadows by the fire escape. He's got a voic sounds like he's been gargling glass.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: I heard you were lookin' for a story.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Who... Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Just a guy with a little information lookin' to make a buck. But maybe I heard wrong. You don't look like much of a reporter to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy gulps back her fear, determined to live up to her j

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: You give me something worth printing and I'll get you your money. What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE
dialogues.text: The guy they call the Mask and why Dorian Tyrel's willing to pay fifty large to get him.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: How do I find this Tyrel?

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE
dialogues.text: Careful, sweet meat. You break this story and he just might find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian and Sweet Eddy casually step through the front doo restaurant's ersatz chalet facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy takes a position by the door as Dorian greets the Swede at a large oak table in the festeively decorate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Swede is flanked by his gunsels as he's served by a b blonde waitress in a classic peasant girl costume.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: Dorian... thanks for coming by, kid.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: My pleasure, Swede. It's been too long. I was worried you were still pissed about that little thing with Harry the Hat.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: That? It was nothing. He was a pain in my ass anyway. Here, sit down, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the new casino.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: Thanks, but it might be a little early to celebrate. As a matter of fact that's why I asked you to stop by.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: Here... have a little something to eat. That's Svenska meatballs, kid. The real thing.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian starts to eat.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: So, I tell you Dorian, it's a terrible shame. I put all my hard work into this beautiful casino and what do you think? All the sudden I got all kinda problems with the city. Big problems. The whole deal could fold.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help you out. I'm expecting to come into a little investment capital shortly. If worse comes to worse and you really need to bail out...

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: What a sweet guy. Isn't this guy a sweetheart? Thanks for the offer Dorian, but I think maybe I can solve this myself.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: That's right. You know that Councilman you got in your pocket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian freezes with a forkful of meatballs halfway to his He notices a PINK CARNATION squashed into the gravy.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Well now you've got 'im in your mouth. How you like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Swede and his men have a good laugh as Dorian spits o meatball. The Swede pulls a gun and jams it under Dorian'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy goes for his gun, but one of the Swede's men p jamming a barrel to his temple.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (to Dorian) Now listen close scumbag! You want to bw in business with me? Okay, we're partners now. I'm takin' fifty per cent off the Monkey's Paw. You screw with me again and I'll send you straight down to Hell with your scumbag councilman. You can apologize for eatin' him for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Sure, Swede. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: Good. Now get out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian rises.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: Oh Dorian, here's a couple tickets to my grand opening. Stop by. And try to dress up nice. It's good for business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Mask Robs Bank - Police Scour The City." It's accomp a grainy blow-up of the Mask from the bank video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jams a quarter in the slot, opens the machine and pulls o entire stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to reveal Stanley, still looking pale and desperate as he the entire stack of papers in a nearby garbage can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to turn away when he notices an ad on the back paper for a book... "The Masks We Wear" by Dr. Arthur Neu

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: man we saw interviewed on "The Larry King Show." The byli "The Mysterious Powers of the Identities Within Us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rips out the ad and hurries off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. - MASKS... Dozens of them line one wall. Tribal mask Victorian masks. Ceramic masks. Masks from all countries cultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley paces the plush office like a caged animal while Neuman sits nearby toying with his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: This is extremely unusual, Mr. Ipkiss. Barging in without an appointment or...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Look, you're the big expert on masks, right? Well, I've got an emergency here! (his face TWITCHES)

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Try to calm yourself. Now this woman you were telling me about, I'm not sure I understand the problem.

dialogues.speaker: STANELY
dialogues.text: I've got a date with the girl of my dreams, only she doesn't know it's me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley suddenly reaches into his briefcase and pulls out mask.

dialogues.speaker: STANELY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: It's this thing!

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: (takes the mask) Very interesting... looks like tenth or eleventh century Scandinavian. Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (snatches it back) I found it... or it found me. I'm not sure. The problem is it's ruining my life!

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: So you believe this actually changes you into a different person?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Yes! (face twitches) It's turning me into some kind of lunatic! (briefly CONTORTS into a Mask expression)

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Ipkiss, please. This is just obsessional dellusion. What you have here is nothing more than a piece of wood.

dialogues.speaker: STANELY
dialogues.text: But your book says masks...

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: My book uses masks as a metaphor for our complex personalities. The masks we must present to the outside world... to suppress the id. To protect our innermost desires.

dialogues.speaker: STANELY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well this one works in reverse.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: You're going to have to be willing to work on this delusion or...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: It's not a delusion! Alright, I'll prove it to you if I have to, but I won't be responsible for the consequences.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Ipkiss please! There is no such thing as a magical mask.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (holds up mask) Last chance to hide all dangerous objects.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Alright then, go on. You're not going to frighten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley takes a deep breath and shoves the mask onto his

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Whooooooooaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts spinning around.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Whoa, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley just stands there like an idiot. Nothing happened tries it again. Same result.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: It didn't work?

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Does that surprise you? The mask is nothing but a reflection of you - the inner you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley isn't listening. He's thinking out load.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: It worked last night. And the night before. Maybe it only works at night... What kind of mask did you say this was.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Scandinavian. It looks like a representation of Loki, the Norse God of Mischief. He supposedly caused so much trouble that Odin banished him from Valhalla forever.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (GASPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he banished him... into a mask?

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Ipkiss, we're out of time.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: But what should I do about my date?

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Your date?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You know. Tonight. The park. Tina. Do I go as myself of the Mask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Neuman puts an arm around Stanley and leads him to th

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEUMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Ipkiss, please. Haven't you been listening to anything I've been saying? Go as yourself. And as the Mask. (a beat) Because they are the one and the same, beautiful person

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley sees this is a losing battle. He turns and walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Kellaway sits in this unmarked police car, finishing lunch. The police band comes on. Kellaway grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVERAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've got that cross-check from the bank files.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVERAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Ipkiss, Alright. Stanley Ipkiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway smiles to himself. At that moment -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes out of Dr. Neuman's office building. He gets in his drives off.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVERAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You want us to pick him up?

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Don't do a thing until I tell you. Just keep the SWAT team standing by. If this guy's half as bad as he's supposed to be we'll need all the help we can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires up his engine and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topiaried ivy reads: "Welcome to Peninsula Park." A small below that reads: "No dumping."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying his briefcase, Stanley enters the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley passes through a stand of trees and nearly bumps Tina.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Stanley, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, Tina... Hi. You're early.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I just... wanted to make sure you two got together okay.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: That's nice. (sits down) You know, I hardly ever stop by here. It's hard to believe it was just a garbage heap.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (looking at the sky) It's always beautiful at sunset. Those methane emissions really pick up the colors.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Wow. They really do. All those pinks and greens.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Well... I'm sure my cousin will be along any minute. He never shows up anywhere 'till after sundown. He's sort of strange that way. (RISES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll get going.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: No, Stanley. Stay for a second. I was thinking about what you said and I, uh, I want you to know I appreciate it. Maybe you're right. If I believed in myself a little more I wouldn't rely on guys like Dorian.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Dorian... You mean Dorian Tyrel?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's sort of my manager.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Tina, you've got to be careful of that guy. He's a dangerous criminal.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: You really mean that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Absolutely. You ought to hear the stories...

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: No, I mean, you're really worried about me. That's... real sweet, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Tina this is serious. How involved are you with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself, Stanley. I always have.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, really? People close to Tyrel have a nasty habit of turning up dead, or haven't you noticed?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Look, this may sound a little cold but I do what I have to do to get by, okay? I'm nobody in this town without Dorian.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: And who are you with him Tina? I'm not exactly sure who I am anymore but at least I'm trying to find out. If you really had any faith in yourself, you wouldn't be hanging on to some kind of free ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That last bit stung, and Stanley knows it. A shadow falls them as the last rays of the sun disappear behind the clo

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Tina. I guess I better get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley gets up and hurries off through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (RISES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley... wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's already disappeared. Tina starts to follow after she hears a strange WHOOOSH. A whirlwind begins to kick u leaves all  around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask leaps out from behind a stand of trees in all hi and literally sweeps her off her feet. With his lower lip out he romances  Tina in a deep syrupy French voice.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK
dialogues.text: Cher! Ce moi! Je'taime, Je' taime, Je any old tame! At last we are together mon petite bon bon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway, Doyle, and two other officers are watching from distance. He speaks into his walkie talkie in hushed tone

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: This is Kellaway. I need back up and I need it now! Every available man down to Peninsula Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MURRAY, an old timer newshound hurries into the room, gra notebook and pulls on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Looks like it's gonna be a long night. My wife is gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: What is it, Murray?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: The cops got your pal Ipkiss staked out at Peninsula Park. We just picked it up over the police band.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Let me cover it, Murray! You go on home to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: I don't know, Peggy. Ramsey said...

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: (grabs her coat) I'll take care of Ramsey. Thanks a million. I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Murray a quick peck on the cheek and runs out t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask is all over Tina like a cheap suit, stroking her grabbing her bod. She's definitely having second thoughts him as he backs  her up to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK
dialogues.text: Our love is like a red red rose, and I'm feeling so thorny already, I'd like to nip you in the bud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ducks his grab, but he recovers smoothly, flipping ou of cigarettes. He pops one in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand is a blur of motion as he sticks dozens of cigar her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Regular? Menthol? Filter? Cigar? Cigarette? Tiparillo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces a huge blow torch from within his jacket and the flame.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Let me get that for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the gigantic wad of cigarettes as if they were o them in his own mouth and applies the blow torch. With on

dialogues.speaker: SSSUCK
dialogues.text: he smokes them all down to gray ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ash tumbles away.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (exhales a huge cloud of smoke) Aaaaaah. And now... amore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws his arms wide and lunges at Tina.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask freezes in mid-air, arms outstretched and feet s off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Put your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask's lips barely move as he speaks in a tiny voice side of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK
dialogues.text: But eu 'tol me 'oo freeze!

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. Unfreeze! You're under arrest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask instantly drops to the ground and throws himself wildly exaggerated expressions of remorse and pain.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK
dialogues.text: Under arrest! My god! The Law! I knew I'd forgotten something! (TEARS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so young! So foolish! So full of life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears are gushing from Stanley/Mask's eyes like twin wate He puts his hands out and Kellaway slaps on the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: THE MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: What... What'll they do with me, Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Sorry, son. That's not my department. Search him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle reaches into the Mask's zoot suit and starts tossin on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Comb - Flintstones vitamins - Sousaphone - Bazooka - (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: picture of Kellaway's wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway looks down at the photo. It really IS a picture wife with a handwritten note: "Call me, lover - 555-1234!

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: What the --? (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Kellaway LUNGES at Stanley/Mask's neck. Two othe officers restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch -- !

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: Jeez, I figured you had a sense of humor! (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, you married her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask honks Kellaway's nose which makes a loud AHO noise and runs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway starts to follow, but discovers he's now handcuf Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other police officers draw their guns and give chase Stanley RICOCHETS off through the trees hooting laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twelve foot high stone wall surrounds the park. Stanley races through the entryway, SLAMMING the park's huge wood behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask throws an iron bolt, SNAPS on a huge padlock, SL a steel plate ZZZIPS up a gigantic zipper, HAMMERS in doz nails at high speed and throws himself against the gate  panting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then his eyes BUG OUT on stalks as he sees what lies opposite side of the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COPS... more COPS than seems humanly possible. They're in armed antipersonnel carriers, hanging from trees, parachu

dialogues.speaker: FROM
dialogues.text: helicopters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're all aiming serious looking guns at HIM.

dialogues.speaker: BULLHORN VOICE
dialogues.text: It's all over! Put your hands over your head or we'll open fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask looks around, like he's trying to figure a w of this mess - then -

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: Hit it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, a police SPOTLIGHT SNAPS on, and the brightly entry-way becomes a beautifully lit stage. Stanley/Mask s pose,  now wearing a straw hat "boater" and weilding a cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedestrians with radios and ghetto blasters look down in a RUMBA begins playing from every speaker in town.  Stanley/Mask SWAYS seductively in time to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE COP steps forward, a look of surprise spreaading her face as, against her will, she opens her mouth in son

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COP
dialogues.text: They rave about Sloppy Joe - the Latin lothario - but Havana - has a new sensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's "Cuban Pete RUMBA" by Desi Arnaz! (Yes, this is a re song!)

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COP, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: He's really a modest guy - although he's the hottest guy - in HavAAAAna - and here's what he has to saaaay -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask steps up to the "stage" and tilts the boater his eyes, casting a sly glance toward the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: ("Latin" voice) They call me Cuban Pete - I'm King of the Rumba beat - every time I play the maracas I go chick chick chickie boom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene Kelly on acid, Stanley/Mask punctuates his number wi number of sly gestures - winking, nodding, sliding seduct down a  street lamp post, doing repeated "splits" on the sidewalk his big number!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops watch this with open mouthed astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway climbs over two of his men to scale the wall. He believe his eyes. Doyle clamors up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Hey, he's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway shoots him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: waltzes into the street, prancing just inches from the he armed cops. His legs twine around each other like spaghet his upper torso  SPINS until they're straightened out again.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: (still singing) Yessir, I'm Cuban Pete! The craze of my native street! When I start to dance everything goes chick chick chickie boom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like some weird, loony case of mass hypnosis, Stanley/Mas for the "musical break" to coax the armed cops into JOINI on the  number - as the rough and tumble equivalent of CHORUS GIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street takes the look of a Busby Berkeley musical as HIGH STEP in time to the infectious RUMBA beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway leaps/tumbles down from the wall into some bushe scrambles to his feet. He can't believe his eyes. His cop tac squad, his  friggin' SWAT team - they're ALL in the street, dancing w crazy maniac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley/Mask sidles up to a heavily armed female SWAT off "dirty dancing" her across the street -

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY/MASK
dialogues.text: The senoritas they sing, and how they sling their sombreros --! (It's very nice! So full of

dialogues.speaker: SPIIIIICE--
dialogues.text: (dip!) And when they're dancing they bring a happy ring to their vaqueros - they sing their song, all the day loonnnggg -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle crash lands beside Kellaway and starts out to join others, but Kellaway grabs him by the back of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You go out there and I'll blow your brains out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Kellaway yanks open the door of an abandoned squ pulls out a tear gas gun and fires into the air. The shar

dialogues.speaker: AND
dialogues.text: stinging gas seems to break the spell of THE MASK. The mu suddenly STOPS and the high stepping cops stagger away fr

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS
dialogues.text: line, looking confused.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Arrest that thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops - shaken back to reality - fumble for their weap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask takes off - dashing into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spots the Mask and races after him, calling his men.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bumps into an OLD LADY who SCREAMS at his hideousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask realizes how obvious he is. He turns away and br arms to his head. There's a RIPPPING sound. And when he t around,  the Mask has now transformed back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the mask, Stanley tries to blend in with the cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: followed by a handfull of officers bears down on him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Halt! Halt or we'll shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley quickly cuts down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley races down the lane - cops hot on his trail. Bull EXPLODE all around him. Just as he reaches the next stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screeches to a halt - almost running Stanley over. The wi rolls down revealing...

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Stanley! Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley jumps into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy rips around the bend, easily outdistancing the cops

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Someplace where we'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley and Peggy sit on stacks of bound newspapers in th shadowy shipping room. In the b.g., a huge machine spews hundreds of  newspapers on an assembly line. Everything's mechanized:  printing, folding, wrapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy hands Stanley a cup of coffee. He's a complete wrec clothes disheveled, rings under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: I saw it. I saw the whole thing. What's happening to you, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: It's crazy... I've lost all control. When I put on this mask I can do anything... be anything, but it's ruining my life.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Stanley, I don't know what's happening to you, but I do know this. That letter you sent my column was from a guy with more guts and heart than any of the creeps I've met in Edge City. Whatever this mask is, you don't need it. You... Stanley Ipkiss, are already all you ever need to be.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Gosh, Peggy. Do you really mean that?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually... no.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now hear a door open and footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: (RISES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you guys so long? I've been vamping here for twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian and three of his men stand there with their guns t on Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: This is him?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: You have the fifty thou?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy FLICKS open a briefcase lined with cash.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Right. When he puts on the mask he becomes that green thingamajig.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (still dumbfounded) Peggy, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Stanley. You really are a great guy, but I just can't lose my condo. You know how hard it is to find an apartment in this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy and a second thug grab Stanley and hang him ov steel maw of the whirring news press.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Okay Ipkiss. Where's the money from the heist?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: My aparment. It's in my apartment!

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Now I believe you have a pressing engagement.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Hey, you said you wouldn't hurt him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian toys with the wooden mask, enjoying his control ov situation.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: You're right. Easy boys. One thing at a time. Tell me about this mask, Ipkiss. How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I don't know... You just put it on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mask FX theme builds, Dorian raises the mask to his f

dialogues.speaker: SWEET EDDY
dialogues.text: Better be careful, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a CRACK of thunder a whirlwind of light and power sw around Dorian's figure. Unlike Stanley's transformation, is much more  diabolical. He grows and changes within a nimbus of ROARI light. Finally the light dies away and Dorian/Mask rises circle of swirling  smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Stanley was a zoot suited bee-bopper in hyper-drive Dorian/Mask is more like a hulking evil GENIE, fresh out lamp and pissed at  the world. His diamond earring and touches of his neuvo-g look is still apparent, but his huge grin stretches out l

dialogues.speaker: TYRANNOSAURUS
dialogues.text: Rex's under eyes that glow green with wicked power. His v a deep inhuman RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: What a rush.

dialogues.speaker: SWEET EDDY
dialogues.text: Whoa, boss... are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: I'm better than ever, you idiot. Now stop the presses. There'll be a new headline tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy stands there looking disappointed with Ipkiss held dangling above the churning presses.

dialogues.speaker: SWEET EDDY
dialogues.text: But what about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian/Mask wheels about and ROARS at Sweet Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: DO AS I SAY! I have other plans for Ipkiss. Everything's become so clear to me now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy sheepishly reaches for the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Ah... excuse me. If you don't mind, I'll just take my money and be going. You guys make yourselves at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian/Mask slides up to Peggy threateningly.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Must you go? What a shame. You and I could make beautiful headlines together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy removes his arm from her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Thanks, anyway. That wasn't part of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy snatches the briefcase, but Dorian/Mask blocks her

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Of course. You only want what's coming to you, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy whips out a snub-nose .38 out from beneath her coat

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Back off Freakazoid. I wasn't born yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Ah... But you might die today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian throws the switch and the presses CHURN to life. I flash he snatches Peggy off her feet.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: A girl like you deserves to have her face plastered all over page one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses her into the grinding mill of steel and paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BOOMS DOWN as Peggy's feet disappear between the p huge rollers and continues down, down past the whirling g hydraulics to finally ENDFRAME on the chute where the new roll out on a conveyor belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlines in blood red ink now read: "Reporter Killed in Accident" next to a picture of a slightly flattened-looki Peggy, her mouth open  in a silent scream.

dialogues.speaker: SWEET EDDY
dialogues.text: What do we do with Ipkiss?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: The police are looking for the Mask. We shall give them the Mask. And Eddy...

dialogues.speaker: SWEET EDDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dorian?

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Get the boys ready. The Swedes' expecting us at the casino opening tomorrow night. We wouldn't want to disappoint him, would we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian/Mask throws his head back and lets loose a deep BO LAUGH. It's unnerving even to Eddy, but he laughs nervous

dialogues.speaker: RESPONSE
dialogues.text: and elbows the other thugs to join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked open and two of Dorian's henchmen burs the room. Milo leaps off the couch and scrables behind th curtains. They  yank open the closet door and start scooping the cash int plastic garbage bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley lies in the back seat, gagged, bound hand and foo half hidden under a blanket. A thug in the driver's seat his .45 under  Stanley's nose.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: That money better be where you said it was, Ipkiss or you can Ipkiss your ass goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chuckles at his own little joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo peeks out from behind the curtain as the henchmen fi their job. He ducks behind the curtain and looks out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the henchmen's car. Stanley can barely be seen peeking car window. The henchmen pushes him back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ears perk up. The boss is in trouble! He checks back the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: finish up and start out the door carrying the trash bags. races right by them, just out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The henchmen hop in and start the engine. As the car peel into traffic, Milo appears, valiantly racing along the si

dialogues.speaker: DODGING
dialogues.text: pedestrians and cross-traffic to keep the car in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dejected, Lt. Kellaway heads up the steps with Sgt. Doyle

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: I still can't believe it. Hardened cops dancin' in the streets... and broadcast all over the ten o'clock news.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: The SWAT team got an offer to open for Wayne Newton.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: I'm history. The Captain's going to have my badge for breakfast. With a little pension on top.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: C'mon Lieutenant, it wasn't your fault. Something will turn up.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Sure. Stanley Ipkiss is going to fall right into my lap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car SCREECHES BY. The door flies open and a BODY comes out - knocking Kellaway down. He looks up at the body sit

dialogues.speaker: HIS
dialogues.text: lap -

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: ...Ipkiss!

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I can explain everything...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Don't bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle pulls a GREEN RUBBER MASK out of Stanley's pocket. starts hauling him up the precinct steps.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent, you freakin' Looney Tune. Anymore of your half-baked wisecracks can and will be used against you by me, personally...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You've got to listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway and Doyle drag Stanley into the precinct - just charges up. But the dog is shut out of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruised, beaten and exhuasted - Stanley's thrown into a s cell. The KEY-GUARD locks the cell up - then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks around his dismal quarters. A filthy toilet cot even worse. There's a YOWLING. He climbs up on the co looks out the  small, barred window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a dumpster below the window, overflowing with tra to the trash heap - is MILO. The dog looks up at Stanley happily.  Stanley forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Go find yourself a new home, Milo. It looks like I'm going to be here for a long long time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo watches Stanley recede back into the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley lies on his cot - staring at the ceiling. The Gua on the door.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Wake up. You gotta visitor.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: About time you found me a lawyer... (a beat) ...Tina?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Hello, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Your boyfriend kick you out for not delivering me on schedule?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Is that what you think - that I set you up?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I've got plenty of time to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: You're just going to have to trust me on this.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Now is not the best time for me on trusting women.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I ran out on Dorian last night, Stanley. I just came to tell you I'm sorry. Sorry about everything.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: You ran out on him?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: That magic mask of yours turned him into some kind of monster...

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: He wasn't exactly Mother Theresa in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: He's going to the casino opening tonight and he's planning to do something terrible.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: A real change of pace for him.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Half this town will be there Stanley. I tried to tell the cops, but they wouldn't listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: As long as he's got the mask, there's nothing they can do to stop him anyway. There's nothing anyone can do.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: There must be some way. How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like it brings you innermost desires to life. If deep down inside you're a little repressed and... a hopeless romantic, you become sort of a love-crazy wild man.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: And if you've got a black heart?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Then the world's going to be a very dark place. And if I were you, I'd get out of town. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina takes a beat and absorbs this information.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Lots of things. For really believing in me when I couldn't. For sharing a sunset with me. For being the first guy to treat me like I was a person instead of a slab of meat. (a beat) And for being any kind of romantic. Even a hopeless one.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (SOFTENING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: You know, that night at the club I knew I met someone special. Someone like nobody I'd ever met before.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: The Mask.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: No... the guy that was inside the Mask all the time. You. Stanley Ip -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They draw closer. The iron bars scrunch up their faces...

dialogues.speaker: TINA, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: --kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They KISS. A sweet, soft and romantic kiss. Then... the K pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: KEY-GUARD
dialogues.text: Time's up, lady.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I've got to disappear for awhile Stanley. I'm not sure where I'll go but I'll let you know as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley takes a long last look at Tina as she's escorted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warily, Tina slips out of the precinct. She's about to cr street, but spots a SUSPICIOUS LIMO, engine idling. Quick doubles back  and heads -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the station. She looks over her shoulder. No one's Tina hurries toward the next street and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: roars up, cutting her off. She turns and runs back the wa came - but freezes when THE LIMO screeches up, blocking h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy and Hicks jump out of the limo. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley watches helplessly as Tina is dragged into the li Frantic, Stanley runs to the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (to the Key-Guard) Hey! A girl's being kidnapped out there! Do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUARD tunrs up the volume on JEOPARDY, drowning Stanl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slick/modern house on the hills overlooking Edge City. Eddy pulls Tina from the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy and Huey enter and push Tina roughly into the Dorian rises to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: (SARCASTICALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, there you are... (he embraces her) I was gettin' all worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I just went out for a little while Dorian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy holds up a small suitcase and an overstuffed s bag he got from her car.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Looks like maybe a long little while, right baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian grabs her by the throat and SLAMS her against the The pictures rattle.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: You know what happened to the last bitch that ran out on me? Do you?!

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (CHOKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Nobody else does either. Nobody ever will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses her onto the bed. She lies there gasping for br

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: Now fix yourself up, baby. And pick out something pretty to wear tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian picks up the mask and admires it.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: We're going to make a big splash at that opening. One this town will never forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agitated, Stanley paces around the room. Stanley's eyes p An IDEA! He stands up, clunking his heaad on the upper bu

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: peers down the hall and sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching a TV boxing match. He's CHEWING on the leather k strap. There's a half eaten sausage and a wedge of cheese desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: climbs up on the cot and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (stage whisper) Milo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a pile of trash. The dog's gone. Then... a RUSTLE. A blanket moves... and MILO emerges from it - tail waggling sees Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little dog jumps up, helplessly trying to reach the w

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Come on, boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo gets an idea. He jumps on boxes and trash bags, usin as steps. He climbs higher and higher until he's reached of the  dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Come on, Milo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo jumps from the dumpster. He almost reaches the windo falls back down again into the trash heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog leaps a second time. On this jump, Stanley grabs brings him through the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley gathers Milo up in his arms. The dog licks his fa YELPS joyously. Stanley muzzles him and peeks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Key-Guard's SNORING in his chair. The chewed leather chain strap is still in his MOUTH. His half-eaten sausage cheese still lies  before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shows Milo the guard, then whispers in the dog's ear.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Keys, Milo. Get the keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo cocks his head at the sound of the word KEYS. He zip through the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo trots down the hall and approaches the key-guard's s The dog stares and sniffs at the SNORING man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo returns, slipping back into the cell.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Good boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the wedge of cheese out of the dog's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: I said "keys" not "cheese"! Keys. K-E-Y-S... keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pushes the dog back out the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the guard and stops - staring at the keys d from the man's mouth. Milo jumps up on the desk and bites

dialogues.speaker: THE
dialogues.text: key-chain. He starts to pull when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard stirs and almost wakes up. Milo freezes. A mome later, the guard starts SNORING again. Milo grabs the key trots back to  Stanley's cell.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Atta boy, Milo. Now let's see if we can get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built on pilings at the edge of the marina, the extravaga Vegas-like structure looks like a stylized Viking castle. (Production note: Key mater  shots will be matte paintings.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTERS and tuxedoed GUESTS crowd around as the Swede a DIGNITARIES prepare to cut a huge red ribbon and official the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two statuesque BLONDES in scanty Valkyrie (Viking goddess costumes present the Swede with a gigantic pair of SCISSO

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: applaudes and flashbulbs POP.

dialogues.speaker: THE SWEDE
dialogues.text: So, ladies and gentlemen with a special thanks to Mayor Tilton and everyone else who made this possible, I give you... the Valhalla Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a mighty SNAP of the scissors the Swede cuts the rib the doors of the casino open wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian's limo barrels through the streets of Edge City fo by two sedans full of his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it disappears behind the clouds. CAMERA PULLS BACK as limo's moon roof slides shut. We tilt down to discover Do Tina,  dressed to the nines for the opening. Dorian holds the ma his lap.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN
dialogues.text: It's almost time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina nervously starts to light a cigarette. Dorian snatch lighter away from her.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that, Sweetie. We don't want to start the celebration early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian flips back a blanket covering four compact wooden marked "C-7 - Caution U.S.M.C. Demolition Materials."

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Now sit back and try to relax. I've got to change for the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian slowly raises the mask to his face as Tina watches horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tinted glass LIGHTS UP from inside like muted firewor Dorian's transformation begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS from his snoring mouth down to his gun as a h carefully lifts it out of his holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun in hand, Stanley silently backs away with Milo at his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard chokes off a snore and begins to wake up. He se Stanley's cell door standing open and goes for his gun... grasps air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: puts one hand over his eyes and slams the butt of the gun hard as he can on the Guard's head. THONK. The Guard drop

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: on his chair unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley peeks from beneath his hand and regards his work. bad. Milo yips happily.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley turns and starts for the door when he bumps strai Lt. Kellaway.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Ipkiss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is shocked, but quickly realizes he's got the gun points it at Kellaway with greater authority.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hold it! I warn you! I'm seriously stressed out here!

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Easy, Ipkiss. Don't be an idiot. You're in the middle of a police station. There's no way you're just going to walk out of here.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pockets Kellaway's gun while keeping him covered Guard's gun. He pulls the handcuffs from Kellaway's belt begins to  handcuff the two of them together.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Now what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Putting myself in your custody.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: You are certifiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley unbuttons his shirt and holds it open.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Milo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo immediately jumps inside and Stanley buttons up. He looks like he has a pretty nasty pot belly, but otherwise

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Okay. Now we have to hurry or we'll miss the party.

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Of course. We wouldn't want to keep Alice and the white rabbit waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping the gun jammed in Kellaway's ribs, Stanley folds jacket over his gun hand. We hear it cock beneath the jac LATCH.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Now move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening is in full swing as the limo and two sedans p to the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the CAR HOP attempts to open the passenger door, it EX off and shoots ten feet from the car taking the unfortuna Hop with it.  Dorian/Mask steps out of swirling mists within the limo i his wicked green glory.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Don't be shy, Tina. I know how you like to make an entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her out of the limo.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: And I must say, that's a dress to die for. Or should I say in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian's men scramble, hauling the C-7 out of the limo an off into the darkness with their automatic weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Kellaway and Stanley march past POLICEMEN, FELONS and CITIZENS in the front desk area looking stiff and unnatur hell. Doyle  waves hello from the coffee service as he munches on a ch doughnut.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Hi Lieutenant. Where are you taking Ipkiss?

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Ixnay! Ehay's otgay an ungay... ouch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley jams him in the ribs with that hidden gun.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo pokes his head up out of Stanley's shirt, but Stanle instantly pushes it back down. Doyle does a double-take w what's wrong  with this picture as they continue their stiff-legged wal the door. Doyle gives an uncertain wave with his half-eat doughnut.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: ...See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BOOMS DOWN. The casino is a true Caesar's Palace s show place featuring a dragon-prowed Viking ship that's t

dialogues.speaker: CENTERPIECE
dialogues.text: of the room. The gaming floor is packed with happy PARTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA ENDFRAMES on Charlie Schumacher as he snatches a d a passing WAITRESS' tray and turns to a gorgeous Valkyrie girl whose helmet has two large horns sticking out of it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hello tall, Nordic and beautiful. One look at you and I know how your hat feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Mrs. Peenman appears, pushing her way past Charl a paper bag filled with quarters.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEENMAN
dialogues.text: Out of my way, Buster. Mama feels lucky tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jams a quarter in a slot machine right behind Charlie throws her weight behind the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they suddenly EXPLODE inward, blowing Security Man off feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian/Mask steps through the smoking ruin dragging Tina him. He's flanked by a half dozen of his heavily armed me

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Now... let the games begin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed Security pull their weapons, but are immediately bl by the thugs. The crowd is thrown into a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it tears through the streets of Edge City with its sir BLARING. Kellaway sits in the rear of the car with his ha cuffed behind his back.  Stanley's at the wheel with Milo at his side. Kellaway is

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: Ipkiss, I'll have you locked up for this so long sex will be safe again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellaway is thrown into the door as Stanley SCREECHES aro corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened crowd mills about in terror as Dorian's th off the exits. They frisk down their captives for loot an jewelry. Orlando runs  up to Dorian/Mask with canvas sacks filled with money.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: We scored over half a mil from the safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD now pops out from behind a mock-stone pi opens fire on Dorian. BLAM. BLAM. BLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando dives for cover. The bullets seem to have no effe Dorian rips a Viking spear off a wall display and hurls i straight across the room  with supernatural force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spear SKEWERS the Security Guard, sends him flying ba PINS him to a slot machine which immediately rings TILT a spills out  quarters.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: You can come out now, Orlando. I think he got the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian hauls Tina over to the Vikin ship where his men ar up boxes of C-7 and sticks of dynamite. He slams her up a the prow as  his men lash her in place with coils of rope.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Let me go you bastard!

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: What's wrong darling? This is your big production number. You of all people know how important it is to go out with a bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian pulls his walkie talkie out.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Eddy... How goes it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eddy and two other Thugs are busy wiring explosives pillars that support the pier the casino rests on.

dialogues.speaker: SWEET EDDY
dialogues.text: All set boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian plugs the timer into the nexus of all the wiring.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Excellent. The real party starts now and ends in... (sets timer) Thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley SCREECHES to a halt in the cop car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Kellaway, brandishing his gun.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Okay. When I push the red button the safety is off, right?

dialogues.speaker: KELLAWAY
dialogues.text: I'm not helping you, Ipkiss.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Alright, suit yourself. (to Milo) You stay and be a good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Stanley shuts the door Milo starts pawing at t handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Swede scrambles under a crap table to escape the mayh bumps into Mayor Tilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, watch it! Oh, Arnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the entire table is lifted away as if it were a toy and they look up into the evil grinning of Dorian/Mas

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Swede... my dear, dear business partner. And Mayor Tilton! What a surprise. We have just enough time left to play my favorite game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Stanley sneaks in an employee's door, the coast looks He snaps off the kitchen lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley spots a THUG standing guard outside the kitchen's doors. He ducks back down behind a barrel and gets an ide label on  the barrel reads "Olive Oil".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thug seems to be enjoying the mayhem when he hears an camera WHISTLE. He pulls out his .45 and cautiously enter kitchen to  investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thug enters, brandishing his gun and cautiously makes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps into a large slick of olive oil and his legs sho out from under him. SLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he slides across the kitchen floor at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Whoaaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Stanley pops up from behind the overturned barre huge frying pan and slams it right into camera. CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: plucks the gun from the unconscious Guard and sneaks into casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley appears out of the kitchen doors and gets the att of the nearest captive party-goers.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Pssst. You guys. Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie turns around.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stanley! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions them over to the kitchen and hands Charlie the

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Start sneaking people out the back. Watch out for the oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley now makes his way deeper into the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo finally manages to pop the lock and the car door ope scurries off towards the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Swede struggles desperately as he's tied to a spoke o wooden NUMBERS WHEEL, a kind of upright roulette wheel th

dialogues.speaker: OF
dialogues.text: the casino's attractions. Mayor Tilton and two other town dignitaries are tied to the other three spokes.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDE
dialogues.text: Let me offa this thing, you lousy scumbag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian/Mask pulls three Viking hand axes off a wall displ casually begins to juggle them.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: Sorry Swede. I've got an ax to grind with you. In fact I got a couple and I'm afraid they may give you a splitting headache!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to one of his men who gives the wheel a big spin. captives SCREAM Dorian prepares to throw his first ax.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Round and round she goes. Who dies first, nobody knows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pops up behind the dragon-prow and starts untying

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Stanley!

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hang on, Tina.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Stanley, look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley ducks just as a Viking ax splits the dragonhead r next to him in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian ROARS with rage as he rushes across the room to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pops back up firing his gun. BLAM. BLAM. BLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian takes the direct hits. He grins horridly at Stanle extends his slimy tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets all stand there on end in a neat little semi-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian now sucks in a mighty breath. Stanley grabs a Viki shield and protects Tina and himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorian blows the bullets back at Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They batter the shield. Stanley's knocked backwards from impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drags Stanley out and SLAMS up against the prow next to T of his men immediately begins tying Stanley in place.

dialogues.speaker: DORIAN/MASK
dialogues.text: How touching! The two love birds. Just to show you there's no hard feelings, I'm going to let you spend the rest of your lives together.
